intro: Hieracium pseudocalodon, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium pseudocalodon is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through its rhizomes.
